title: Murder Train
description: Boston Blackie is on a train when a gambling boss, who was hiding in a locked compartment and protected by a bodyguard, is murdered.

title: Cop Killer
description: Blackie goes after a gang that used a bazooka to rob an armored car, and then killed a cop who was a friend of Blackie's during the getaway. The only clue he has is that the the money was scorched by the bazooka's blast.

title: Oil Field Murder
description: Blackie helps a young woman who is caught up in a scheme by a crooked oilman to sell worthless land.

title: Phone Booth Murder
description: Blackie tries to clear an ex-convict who's charged with murdering a man in a restaurant phone booth. During his investigation he discovers that the restaurant is actually a front for a counterfeiting ring.

title: Blind Beggar
description: Blackie comes upon a "begging" racket, where people pretend to be blind or crippled in order to prey on the sympathies of the public and get money.

title: Fortune Teller
description: Blackie finds himself accused of murdering a gangster who was financing a phony fortune-telling racket.

title: Scar Hand
description: Blackie tries to help a man who is so desperate to get money for his child's medical bills that he's hired a hitman to kill him so the child will get the life insurance money.

title: Faraday Murder Case
description: Blackie helps Inspector Farraday try to find out who planted a bomb in his Dictaphone and took a shot at him. He soon finds that someone has planted a bomb in his own car.

title: Gang Murder
description: Blackie comes to the aid of a young detective who doesn't think the police department has adequately investigated his crooked brother's murder.

title: Toy Factory Murder
description: Blackie investigates the murder of a draftsman who worked for a toy manufacturing company.

title: Roller Coaster Murder
description: The death of a man who fell from a roller coaster is ruled an accident, but Blackie suspects the man was actually murdered and sets out to prove it.

title: High Voltage Murder
description: When the plans for a new metal being developed by the government are stolen, Blackie and Inspector Farraday butt heads over the best way to recover them.

title: Griffith Park Murder
description: When a wealthy man out riding his horse in the park dies of a heart attack, Blackie suspects that it may have actually been murder. His investigation uncovers evidence that points toward the man's gold-digging fianc√©e.

title: The Crusader
description: Blackie suspects a wealthy newspaper publisher of committing murder with a high-powered rifle.

title: Death by Dictation
description: A businessman is murdered and his secretary finds out who the killer is. However, instead of turning him over to the authorities, she tries to blackmail him with an incriminating Dictaphone cylinder.

title: Delmark Diamond Case
description: An immigrant gem cutter is being blackmailed by diamond thieves who've tricked him into believing that he's responsible for a hit-and-run death.

title: Bad Time Charlie
description: The brother of a convicted cop killer takes a shot at Inspector Farraday, claiming that his brother is innocent and that Farraday framed him.

title: The Heist Job
description: Blackie sees a robber jump into a taxi. After a car chase the robber gets away, leaving the taxi driver with a bullet in his arm. The taxi driver is an ex-convict, who Blackie once sent to jail. Blackie believes the taxi driver now to be an honest man and doesn't think he is mixed up in the robbery.

title: The Motorcycle Kid
description: Nick Vincent, an out-of-work youth, takes advantage of a grocery store owner who thinks he's an armed robber when the young man demands prompt service with one hand jammed in his jacket pocket. Seeing how easy it was to steal nearly two-hundred dollars accidentally, Nick purchases a gun and plans to enter a life of crime. At Nick's father's request, Boston Blackie attempts to reason with Nick he can begin his one man crime wave.
